_comment: Created by ianb on 29/05/2014 14:47:07 using v2.1
title: How does breast cancer screening coverage compare to other countries?
analysis_commentary: Breast cancer screening coverage in the UK has been steady over the years with an average of 74%. However, we can observe a slight decline since 2004 from a high of 75.5% to 72.6% in 2011. Again, there was a change in the method of calculation in 2010 which however did not visibly affect the trend. While UK has higher screening rates than Australia, France and Canada, the rates are lower than in the United States and Finland, the best performer.
data_source: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, Health Data
